caption: Absolutely gorgeous restaurant.  Delicious food,  beautifully presented.  Friendly and attentive hosts and servers.

What a lovely place for dinner and drinks. Our server Lauro was very kind and helpful with food recommendations. The ambient is Soho House French style.  Have the chicken and poodle drink! And for dessert....Limoncello shots!!

(Translated by Google) Delicious place to spend an unforgettable evening with the family on December 31st and the spectacular decoration makes you feel in a castle  (Original) Delicioso lugar para pasar una velada en familia el 31 de diciembre inolvidable y la decoración espectacular te sientes en un castillo
Highly recommend! We had an excellent dinning experience -  delicious and authentic French cuisine. Reasonable pricing considering the caliber of the food. Marchesa is a gem!

We rented the Airbnb above the restaurant which is owned by the same people as the restaurant and had them cater a small wedding party there on New Years eve - the food they catered for us was delicious. They added lots of extras and made the whole experience great for us.  Thank you.  They also did wonderful job with sandwiches the day prior with fresh chips and cookies.  Yum!

AMAZING 3 FLORS OF EXCELLENCE AND BEAUTY !! The food is spectacular with a bit of artistic goodness! Fresh, innovative and yet comforting and creative! The wine and champagne list is vast .. and the caviars .. YUMMMMM .. Oh and that Kathryn.. a bonus !!’ 💜💜💜💜💜
Intimate setting, wonderful service. And amazing food.

We ate outside in a three sided tent with two tables. There were a few tables inside next to open windows as well. Food and drinks were excellent as usual. Steak frites for me and duck with pear salad for my better half. I am fat and happy.
Don’t leave Chicago without going here.
Nice location for delicious French food. The food was super appetizing. I had a brother come into town and he asked me to go back here.
french food, yeah, awesome. i love this place, great food & service. it has a great atmosphere.
My sis did not have a good shopping day, so she took me to grieve in this place. Lamb Heritage and the steak frites were amazing! Rose was UNREMARKABLE, but the red was amazing.....we lOve PT!

This was a dinner RSVP set up by a friend. I had met Chef Didier a year or so ago between his restaurants. His food at the Home Party was amazing. Tonight was a step beyond. From the Cavier Parfait, then Frog legs and Pear Salad, to the Mushroom soup, followed by Ocean Trout, Lamb shank entrees. Then finished off with apple tart with creamer and vanilla bean ice cream. Magnificent! The Italian Red and birthday glass of champagne were delightful. Chef has done it again. We highly recommend.

I’ve only ordered from them through Grubhub but each time the food arrives hot and fresh. I think I’ve ordered from them enough times for them to know me by name! LOVE them and can not recommend them highly enough. Once COVID is over I’ll for sure visit them in person.

We got married here, have celebrated birthdays here and dined with many friends here.  It has always been 5 stars with food and service.  I have special dietary needs and the chef has always been the most accommodating. Daniel is one of the best servers so if you have a chance to have him you will be greatly taken care of.
I wouldn't recommend anyone to work there or grab a bite because the service is terrible and the people who work there like the food runner and server assistance is not very nice, and welcome.
The food and service is amazing!
A favorite location for delicious french food. Service treated us so kindly.
I admire this place very much. It has a different feeling. The meals are good. the service is efficient and the team is well trained. The price is reasonable. deeply recommend.
Excellent cocktails and the food was superb. Nice ambiance, fun date spot
We had such a lovely dinner here that in spite of the Chicago street noise, we felt like we were in Paris, sipping cocktails and eating escargot and carpaccio on the patio. C'est magnifique!
Chef Didier is always on point! Oh what a legendary Chef.

We visited Marchesa for our 8th anniversary. Every minute there was full of care and attention. We had the lobster bisque which was rich and yet light enough for a got summer day. The caviar parfait was full of flavor and balanced textures. My wife had the cheese and charcuterie board as an entree and loved every morsel. I had the lamb and it was hands down the best I've ever had. Was a truly lovely and romantic evening.

This place had great food and amazing customer service. My boyfriend and I came here right after the COVID quarantine was lifted and our food was great. We asked if we could be seated inside or closer to a heater and when they could not accomodate this they took off a round of our drinks. Then, my boyfriend ordered steak frites (medium rare) which was quite overcooked. He still enjoyed it but when we mentioned this misstep to the waiter he was very apologetic and took that off the check as well, even when I told him not to. The food here was delicious and the customer service was even better and it was an extremely enjoyable experience.

Counter seats are the only way to experience the amazing food trip you are taken on here at Petite Trois. At the counter you are able to see just how meticulous the chefs are at creating each and every dish that comes out of that kitchen.
Best steak frites I've ever had. And I've been places!
Slow service and food dry and outdated

We love eating out. Yesterday we  visited this superb place which friends told us about. We passed a beautiful evening there with high-qulity dishes and a well-trained crew and a talented  chef. We put this venue in our phone list  and we will definitely come back very soon. We warmly recommend.

Food was great and so was the wine. I recommend going at 5pm to a life the dinner rush on a weekday. However they did not set up the table as I had requested for a special occasion. I had called earlier in the day to confirm our table and had a simple request to set up something nice for an anniversary and when we arrived the table was plain. When I asked the server if he had checked the notes he went and checked and while they were serving us they decided to set the table with half the things they had told me they would have put up. They say they can fulfill simple requests but it doesn’t seem like that is true.

Lovely atmosphere. Food prepared with care and attention to detail. Many restaurant week menus can not compare! Mushroom soup with goat cheese profiterole, duck a l'orange, lamb shank, all to die for! Chocolate pot du creme was decadent!
Was exceptional, shef came out to ask how do we like the food ,. Also waiter from France with a cute accent. Ambience ,food everything was amazing. I would recommend it.
A wonderful evening to celebrate a special birthday.  Food was delicious,  decor beautiful, and Kathy as personable as always.

I would love for this rating to reflect the food but unfortunately we couldn’t get a table to even try the food. They started us out by saying our table wasn’t ready so they offered to have us get drinks while we waited. After 30 minutes they came to us and told us that they called and left a voicemail asking us to confirm the reservation. After waiting another 30 minutes we checked what number they called, turns out they only had 8 digits down instead of the 9 any phone number would have. So instead of admitting their fault, they lied and told us we would have to wait. Needless to say, this place needs a thorough review on customer service and a crash course on how to lie properly. At least make the lie believable, maybe I should invite them to come play secret hitler where we can work on improving their skills.

I had a better experience waiting for my colonoscopy.  I stood there for an hour before I was informed my reservation was canceled. My family flew in from india and I was hoping for an enjoyable experience but of course not.

I will start this review by saying I wish I could give this negative stars. We had a reservation at 8:30 and were told to wait downstairs. Apparently, we were left a voicemail to confirm our reservation. Their worker missed a digit which means we were lied to.. how can you leave a voicemail on an invalid number. I guess their workers are to incompetent to make a correct phone call. We didn’t even find this out until 9pm, 30 minutes after we should have been seated. Talk about trashy, lazy, and underwhelming service. -8.5/10. You get some points for a decent drink, maybe.

Disappointed and sad. The servers were powerless to change the dismal experience we had.. We came for restaurant week and it felt like we were there for a week.  My friends and I had the 4 course menu. The mushroom soup was good. The chicken liver mousse was good. The lamb was basically pot roast. The orange duck was HORRIBLE. I didn't know you could overcook duck, but you can (1 extra star for teaching me something). The desserts were the best part.  We waited for over an hour for the soup and almost an hour in between courses (seriously).  Hard pass on going here again. Beware unless you have a lot of time to kill, money to waste, and you have an underdeveloped palate.
Friendly and tasty.  Amazing time

Where do I begin! I found out about this gem about six months ago, and have been spending my Thursday nights here ever since. The atmosphere at Marchesa is unlike any other place in Chicago. The people, the music, the decor - all wonderful. I recently celebrated my birthday in one of the private dining rooms, and ended the night downstairs, at the Champagne Cave. Everything was fabulous from start to finish! Thank you to the entire team at Marchesa!!
This restaurant is excellent and spacious, the meals was enchanting and the prices were very reasonable. quickly, efficient service and very friendly staff. I recommend this place.

Very elegant decor and cozy atmosphere. Very friendly and knowledge waitress. Delicious food. I got the sea bass and my boyfriend got the beef entree. However, the wait time was much longer than we expected. From the time we ordered, it took over 20 minutes to get one small Brussel sprout salad and about 45 minutes (from ordering) to get our entrees. There were 6-7 tables occupied, including us, so not sure what caused the delay or if that's just the norm. Regardless, we'll return for a second try.

This place is definitely one of the tastiest restaurants in the area. Whenever I come to this place I am greatly pleased. They manage their high  standard service and the topmost level of dishes  they serve. You will be always satisfied with this restaurant. Highly  recommended.
Best lamb chop ever
Seems to be a nice place but for us nothing worked out... long waiting time, partially cold and wrong food
Great food, great service, great place. Nice downstairs and upstairs along with main dining room and bar!

Dined here with friends. The premises are lovely and the food and service (Daniel) were very good. The menu is French, but not overly so. Cocktails here, unlike many new restaurants, do not stinge on alcohol. Wine by the glass offerings were good pours and nice choices. Prices, for the high quality, seemed quite fair. This is definitely a place to which we will return,

First time here and had a wonderful experience. The place is beautiful Great date place. We sat at the bar and had several appetizers and drinks. The bartender David was wonderful and recommended several things we tried. Excargot, Beets, Cheese plate and Shrimp Javon. Could not of been more pleasantly surprised. But, even if the food was not good. The atmosphere is so charming I would not mine.
I eat in this spot a lot since I work nearby. I have to say their service is always great and they keep the spot well organized regularly. Prices are convenient and they serve big portions.
I eat in this spot a lot since I work close by. I must say the customer service is always fantastic and they keep the spot clean at all times. Pricing is fair and they serve big portions.
Cozy. Food is good too.
soooo much detail and soooo much opulence! amazing, beautiful and incredibly comfortable! Bartender was perfect amount of attention!

I admire this place! They serve first-rate meals, their menu is rich, The chef in that spot is a professional, I like a lot trying all their dishes. The dishes are consistently of high qualtity, the attitude towards the customers  is friendly. I visit often this place and I not even once was unsatisfied.  I highly recommend it.
Great place to hang with friends
Marchesa introduced us to their champagne cave 🗝️ and it's for sure a hidden gem! 🙌
The menu and service were ahead of our expectations. I absolutely liked the environment of this restaurant. First-rate spot to take my family out for lunch.
Gorgeous venue. Fantastic hosts. Perfect event.
Food was good atmosphere was wonderful, will go again for a special occasion.
French food and the atmosphere at this spot is very good. honestly my favorite evening place. the prices are good for what you get. they have a lot of good reviews for a reason.
They recently posted a fake comment and tried to spam my language learning blog. I wouldn't trust this restaurant.
Second floor experience is magical. Food is great too.
Really enjoyed the attentive service and upscale offerings. If you're a James Bond Casino Royale fan, they have The Vesper Martini on their menu. Enjoy!
Nikki in the cave is awesome!
Delicious food in an elegant and classy atmosphere. Impeccable service and wonderful wine.

From the moment you enter through the draped door, you are transported to a different world. A work of art! ADDING:  Hosted my 50th birthday soiree here last night in the Apartment. It was a night to remember!  Delicious food, BEST Lobster Bisque EVER! Foie Gras was divine, smoked salmon yummmmm....truffle risotto extra yum, Boeuf Burg Sliders....oh my....potatoe chip with creme fraiche and CAVIAR!!!!!  Yessssssssss. ...scallop ceviche, and a tomato bite....I mean...EXCELLENT. The staff was beyond perfect. And they were never pretentious, just wonderful. This is a GEM!!!!!  All of our 33 guests are already planning trips back. :)
Fantastic food and the service was outstanding. We will be back soon. Beautiful atmosphere, elegant without being pretentious.
Jason, Katherine and Nikki were amazing during recent event.  Great surroundings, ambiance and decor.  Food and drink excellent....highly recommend.....10 stars.

Things restaurant week is for: impressing a new set of diners that you may not have access to otherwise to build your restaurants reputation (and presumably Google rating in a very crowded part of town). Things restaurant week is not for : dumbing down offerings or compromising on service, etc... Just to get people through the door.  We got the second for sure. Even with a reservation, we were seated after almost a 35 minute wait,and even then we had to grab the host who I think had forgotten about us. From there, took another 45 minutes to get the first course. It was... unremarkable. Then came the creamy pasta course (is this a French restaurant?) which was super salty and uninspired. Then our dessert came, and the runner asked if we were sure when we mentioned the mains hadn't come yet... wrong questions bro. Two of our party finally got the "Half Duck a l'orange" - classic French! Impossible to get wrong... But it was really only a sad reheated quarter chicken, and different parts for different dishes even. Manager came after we paid to offer drinks but it was too little too late. Overall 3+ hours and a good story?  Needs to find a chef who loves and appreciates French cuisine and can carry that on to a plate - or go European in general?  Second star is for the host /manager /owner who would be played by Stanley Tucci - he was super hospitable.

Excellent service, beautiful restaurant decoration. Looks like the perfect place for a date. The food wasn't that great. The presentation of the dishes doesn't look like the pictures posted here.  If your date has a sophisticated palate, you should consider other options.
Great staff and delicious food in a comfortable not too formal dining area.  Definately good for a date or small group.  We invaded with a group of 10 and they took excellent care of us.  #datenight
Delicious french food in the area. Visit the downstairs it is worth it
The food is great but sometimes cold. Really nice customer service.
Excellent service, food was great. Our group sat at the chefs table. The speakeasy downstairs was comfy.

Perfectly fine. Doesn't seem to know what it wants to be. The menu reads like French bistro, and the table density suggests that. But the price point and decor are more appropriate for a fine dining French restaurant. Service is very good. Food is typical American version of French dishes; nothing inspired.
Great place

Beautiful meal, stunning decor and freindly service. What else can you ask for? I love the ambiance in the lower level so I recommend having a drink there before moving up to the main dinning for dinner.

Delicious, stunning, attention to detail. We had a small intimate party for my daughter's birthday in their second floor private dining space, where they went above and beyond our expectations. They even accommodated dietary restrictions with the utmost care. I had the privilege of meeting the owners, their passion to serve and to create a dining experience comes through in their attention to detail in the food they serve and every corner of the restaurant.

Nice place prices Fri $15-$35 main floor dinner seating and bar, upstairs small outside area and group dinner area, downstairs speak easy type venue thur-sat nights, caberat in Mondays they mentioned, and very top floor Airbnb rent out room someone mentioned very nice
Traditional offerings from France, Italy and Space. Speak easy bar pretty but impersonal service and uninspired drink menu detract from the experience.
Great place to have dinner, great wine list and you can smoke a cigar after. Cheers #goodjuice
Good food but it was also a good place to meet friends. Great scotch but $
Perfect evening with a sumptuous meal and extremely attentive and warm staff.   Elegantly designed space with private rooms and hidden dining gems!
One of our favs! Best steak tartare in the city.

Fabulous food.  I love the uber lush, 5 star treatment and plush interiors.  Very sexy and romantic.   The food... will leave you wanting it every single day..... I did not eat for 2 days before, and I was thrilled with the royal decadent food.   Brunch is to haunt you.. forever... Sexy brunch for sure!

Sorry. Bad experience. The people were fine (wait staff, host, etc.) But the food took nearly two hours... Just an entree, mind you. Mediocre at best. Bland. Cold. I was told there was trouble in the kitchen, and I'm sorry about that. I truly am glad that other patrons are having good experiences, but for me and my wife it was just so disappointing. We had looked forward to it for so long. To Alexa, our server, you were terrific, please know that.

The food is so delicious, and service here is great. My friend and I enjoyed everything we ate here, which included the steak tartare, insalata marchesa, lamb chops, and a bottle of wine. The upstairs and downstairs bars are also very cool! We grabbed a drink there first while waiting for our table.
Very nice ambiance
Great food set in an outstanding decor.
Such a great venue,  food and experience.  Head Chef Mark is an artist of food and pairings.

Good date spot or cocktail sipping joint with your clique. Really cool french apartment upstairs and cocktail lounge with champagne cave in the basement. Later that night, ended up having a long chat with the owner; I can tell you, this aint his first rodeo. Mentioned that the champagne celler is sponsered by Tattinger, which is why bottles of this champagne are decently priced there. He chose the decor and art himself and works with his staff to deliver an exceptional experience in his resturant.
Such a great an upscale place. Jason Clarke is an awesome manager and basically all the staff there is awesome.

I would give this place 3.5 stars. The good: our waiter Raymond was excellent. He has opinions about the dishes and had some strong recs that were excellent. The shrimp app he raved about was out of this world excellent. The scallops entree is 5 star as well. The La Davina Casati is a light, crisp drink and is a must.  The bad: takes a long time between ordering your drink and receiving it. I mean a long time! The lamb chops although cooked to the perfect temperature had zero flavor. The steak frites, we asked the waiter to cook it to the temperature the chef reccomends. When it came out it was way over cooked. It was just a dried mess, absolutely terrible. The blue cheese dipping sauce for the fries that came with steak frites, I wanted to bottle up and take home with me.  So there was some good and bad. Granted it was only the 2nd night open. So I would definitely go back after a few months for them to work out the kinks. They have an upstairs cigar lounge (yeah!). They also have an upstairs space for party rental. Awesome space so walk up and check it out.  Bill was not super expensive. 2 couples with drinks, app and entrees $244 plus tip.

Great new addition to River North. Elegant decor. Great jazzy music selection (think Ella Fitzgerald or Louis Armstrong).  Food was delicious. Cooked my steak perfectly and my girlfriend loved her salmon dish. Looking forward to going back.
(Translated by Google) One word, beautiful!  (Original) One word, magnifique!
Extraordinary opulence compliments the exquisite cuisine coupled with impeccable service is the only way to describe this new edition to Chicago’s culinary scene!

Visited Marchesa last night for the first time for an after-work wind down, and to explore this new Chicago gem. The elegant, eclectic atmosphere makes one feel at home as soon as you cross the draped threshold. The service is impeccable. You are greeted at the door, your coat is taken, and you are seated quickly. I sat at the bar (seats were comfortable), and was greeted immediately by David, who's warm welcome (and willingness to explain the items on the menu to a south side city boy) made me feel even more at ease. The menu can be daunting for those not prone to frequenting fine dining establishments. I chose a Chardonnay (With David's blessing) and the young lady hosting for the evening recommended the Shrimp Jovan. The food and wine were both great, as to be expected for the price. What was equally as impressive, in my opinion, was the weight and style of the silverware! Alongside the meal came outstanding service. Borderline Opulence (For a great price).  Kathryn and Jason were gracious hosts, and utterly fabulous. "Whisping"  through the restaurant intent on making every detail perfect for their guests. Every inch of this space is immaculate, every detail receiving as much attention as their guests. Fantastic experience. Best of luck! I will be back very soon!

What an amazing experience! They are not fully open yet, but during the “soft open” they have a fantastic limited menu. The steak frites are divine, with two infused butter dishes for dipping steak or fries. The pots de creme is decadent. And the cave downstairs (with a hidden wine cellar) will certainly be a place we book for company parties this year.
Very limited menu, not impressed with the food.
Wonderful atmosphere and exceptional service. A hidden treasure!
